topics.title: International tours and squad strategy
topics.summary: How Australia is juggling heavy travel schedules with selection calls for India and the Caribbean.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Series outlook
Selectors are keeping one eye on the Border-Gavaskar rematch while managing player loads during the white-ball swing through the Caribbean. The men pivot from subcontinent spin plans to extra pace options in Perth, while the women balance WBBL commitments with a multi-format Ashes defence.

### Key talking points
- Rotation policy for frontline quicks across formats.
- Batting order tweaks to cover a recovering Steve Smith.
- Match simulation camps for the women's squad before England arrive.

callouts.title: Why it matters
callouts.markdown:
- Australia plays nine internationals in 28 days.
- Selection decisions now flow directly into World Cup qualification scenarios.

callouts.title: Watch the travel
callouts.markdown: Perth, Melbourne, Barbados, then Chennai across six weeks demands strong recovery protocols.

topics.summary: Grassroots programs and Australia A tours shaping the next generation.
topics.curatedCopy:
## Building the pipeline
Cricket Australia is funnelling extra support into remote communities while academy coaches celebrate cross-code recruits. The Australia A schedule doubles as a trial for future World Cup squads, and Premier Cricket clubs are experimenting with twilight rounds to draw bigger crowds.

### Spotlight initiatives
- First Nations cricket festivals expanding into the NT.
- PlayCricket club grants for regional Victoria.
- Australia A mixed-format tour giving fringe players multi-day exposure.
